snippet: The Kremlin raised pressure on Russia’s opposition movement on Monday, searching the homes of several of its leading figures ahead of a large demonstration in central Moscow planned for Tuesday.
abstract: Kremlin raises pressure on Russia's opposition movement, searching the homes of several of its leading figures ahead of large demonstration planned to take place in central Moscow; raids target some of the youngest and most vigorous opposition leaders, including Kseniya Sobchak, television star who has long been considered untouchable because of her family connections to Pres Vladimir V Putin.

byline.contributor: Andrew Roth and Anna Kordunsky contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The Kremlin raised pressure on Russia’s opposition movement on Monday, searching the homes of several of its leading figures ahead of a large demonstration in central Moscow planned for Tuesday.

headline.main: Raids Target Putin’s Critics Before Protest
headline.print_headline: Raids Target Putin’s Critics Before Protest
